TEXT.citation: Early, R. J., & Whitehorn, J. (2003). One hundred Paiwan texts. Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University.
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @book{100paiwantexts, author = {Robert Early and John Whitehorn}, title = {One Hundred Paiwan Texts}, year = {2003}, publisher = {Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University}}
TEXT.source: told by Giłgiław of Vałulu village

S.FORM: izua za mareqali tia Piyaqan kati Tsabłiłaq.
izoa za mareqali tia Piyaqan kati Cabljiljaq.
S.TRANSL: There were two friends called Piyaqan and Tsabłiłaq.

S.FORM: "ari kivala-i, qalian, sema ta vavayavayan," aya ti Piyaqan.
"ari kivala-i, qalian, sema ta vavayavayan," aya ti Piyaqan.
S.TRANSL: “Come on, friend, let’s go and visit the girls,” said Piyaqan.

S.FORM: "ari," aya ti Tsabłiłaq.
"ari," aya ti Cabljiljaq.
S.TRANSL: “Let’s go,” said Tsabłiłaq.

S.FORM: vaik tia mareqali a kivala sema tua vavayavayan.
vaik tia mareqali a kivala sema toa vavayavayan.
S.TRANSL: So the friends went to visit the girls.

S.FORM: tjumaq tia mareqali.
tjomaq tia mareqali.
S.TRANSL: The friends went indoors.

S.FORM: "kasinu mun, ła kiḍi," aya ti Piyaqan taza sudju nimadju a ti Kałałułału.
"kasino mon, lja kidri," aya ti Piyaqan taza sodjo nimadjo a ti Kaljaljoljaljo.
S.TRANSL: “Where have you been to, girls?” said Piyaqan to his girl-friend Kałałułału.

S.FORM: "na i umaq amen; 'ka i umaqi anga,' ka aya mun tjanuamen.
"na i omaq amen; 'ka i omaqi anga,' ka aya mon tjanoamen.
S.TRANSL: “We’ve been at home; seeing that you said ‘Let’s stay at home’.

S.FORM: qau kasinu mun avuaq?" aya ti Kałałułału.
qao kasino mon avoaq?" aya ti Kaljaljoljaljo.
S.TRANSL: And where have you been today?” said Kałałułału.

S.FORM: "namaya na i umaq amen uta.
"namaya na i omaq amen ota.
S.TRANSL: “We’ve been at home too.

S.FORM: łakua ika men a napatsun tjanusun.
ljakoa ika men a napacon tjanoson.
S.TRANSL: But we didn’t see you.

S.FORM: 'aki maya sema vavua,' aya men."
'aki maya sema vavoa,' aya men."
S.TRANSL: We thought you must have gone to the fields,” (said Piyaqan).

S.FORM: "navaik aken a venateq," aya ti Kałałułału.
"navaik aken a venateq," aya ti Kaljaljoljaljo.
S.TRANSL: “I went to wash clothes,” said Kałałułału.

S.FORM: "djałepan a ika men a napatsun tjanusun; manu navaik sun a venateq," aya ti Piyaqan.
"djaljepan a ika men a napacon tjanoson; mano navaik son a venateq," aya ti Piyaqan.
S.TRANSL: “So that’s why we didn’t see you; you went to wash clothes,” said Piyaqan.

S.FORM: pai izua za qali a ti Tsabłiłaq ika qivuivu.
pai izoa za qali a ti Cabljiljaq ika qivoivo.
S.TRANSL: Well his friend Tsabłiłaq didn’t say a word.

S.FORM: "makuda sun, qalian?
"makoda son, qalian?
S.TRANSL: “What’s the matter with you, friend?

S.FORM: ika sun a qivuivu," aya ti Piyaqan taza qali nimadju.
ika son a qivoivo," aya ti Piyaqan taza qali nimadjo.
S.TRANSL: You haven’t said a word,” said Piyaqan to his friend.

S.FORM: "nuki ken a makuda tutsu; tjemengez aken sakamaya," aya ti Tsabłiłaq.
"noki ken a makoda toco; tjemengez aken sakamaya," aya ti Cabljiljaq.
S.TRANSL: “I don’t know what’s the matter with me now; I just feel sleepy,” said Tsabłiłaq.

S.FORM: "pai kataqedan, kama i Tsabłiłaq, nu tjemengez sun," aya ti Kałałułału.
"pai kataqedan, kama i Cabljiljaq, no tjemengez son," aya ti Kaljaljoljaljo.
S.TRANSL: “Well have a sleep then, old Tsabłiłaq, if you’re sleepy,” said Kałałułału.

S.FORM: pai qemereng ti Tsabłiłaq.
pai qemereng ti Cabljiljaq.
S.TRANSL: So Tsabłiłaq lay down.

S.FORM: ini anan ka sekataqed.
ini anan ka sekataqed.
S.TRANSL: He didn’t go fast asleep;

S.FORM: manu namitaqedan ti Tsabłiłaq.
mano namitaqedan ti Cabljiljaq.
S.TRANSL: he just pretended to go to sleep.

S.FORM: "aku a sidudu nusa ti qalian a nataqed," aya ti Piyaqan.
"ako a sidodo nosa ti qalian a nataqed," aya ti Piyaqan.
S.TRANSL: “Blast this friend who has gone to sleep!” said Piyaqan.

S.FORM: manu kirimu a paqetjutj ti Piyaqan.
mano kirimo a paqetjotj ti Piyaqan.
S.TRANSL: Straightaway Piyaqan broke wind.

S.FORM: "ha qalian, uza paqeqe anga sa kuka.
"ha qalian, oza paqeqe anga sa koka.
S.TRANSL: “Come on, friend, the cocks are crowing;

S.FORM: gatsału," aya ti Piyaqan tjai Tsabłiłaq.
gacaljo," aya ti Piyaqan tjai Cabljiljaq.
S.TRANSL: get up!” said Piyaqan to Tsabłiłaq.

S.FORM: pai migatsał ti Tsabłiłaq.
pai migacalj ti Cabljiljaq.
S.TRANSL: Tsabłiłaq got up.

S.FORM: "ika ken a nataqed, qalian," aya ti Tsabłiłaq.
"ika ken a nataqed, qalian," aya ti Cabljiljaq.
S.TRANSL: “I wasn’t asleep, friend,” said Tsabłiłaq.

S.FORM: manu ka paqetjutj ti Piyaqan, sipapazini taza qali nimadju a ti Tsabłiłaq.
mano ka paqetjotj ti Piyaqan, sipapazini taza qali nimadjo a ti Cabljiljaq.
S.TRANSL: So when Piyaqan broke wind he tried to put the blame on his friend Tsabłiłaq.

S.FORM: łakua manu ika nataqed.
ljakoa mano ika nataqed.
S.TRANSL: But he hadn’t been asleep.

S.FORM: pai kełangen tu timadju a napaqetjutj naza vavayavayan.
pai keljangen to timadjo a napaqetjotj naza vavayavayan.
S.TRANSL: So the girls knew that it was Piyaqan who had broken wind.

S.FORM: pai kasuqelaman anga sakamaya ti Piyaqan naza vavayavayan.
pai kasoqelaman anga sakamaya ti Piyaqan naza vavayavayan.
S.TRANSL: So the girls disliked Piyaqan after that.

S.FORM: pai titjen nu ruburu itjen, kasuqelaman itjen nua tja salasaladj.
pai titjen no roboro itjen, kasoqelaman itjen noa tja salasaladj.
S.TRANSL: If we are liars our companions won’t like us.

S.FORM: ika tjen a kinasaluan nua qaliqali.
ika tjen a kinasaloan noa qaliqali.
S.TRANSL: People won’t trust us.
